FEB58C9AA47848DDBE2D265666C6E045.description: Investigate the trade qualifier pathway as an alternate pathway to certification in a non-compulsory trade in Saskatchewan.

7036889324A84E809253AB87BD30A502.description: Differentiate between compulsory (i.e., construction electrician, plumber, refrigeration and air conditioning mechanic, sheet metal worker and sprinkler fitter) and non-compulsory trades in Saskatchewan.

6E04BFA5C4204B9EB1DAEE65DBEB3786.description: Explore opportunities and programs that address the issue of underrepresented populations in the trades.

AAED5D6FFE824601932EA4EA28B5851A.description: Discuss requirements and opportunities for apprentices and journeypersons to train and work in other jurisdictions.

D36BAFFF4FFD4A53A937306AB8B52038.description: Research the qualifications needed to obtain Red Seal and Blue Seal certifications.

950F00F18EC94C15A9B40ADBCCF59485.description: Use appropriate trade-related terminology including: apprentice; journeyperson; indenture; pre-employment training; designated trade and sub-trade; and, advanced standing.

97179B6FE2FB427B9AE5AA7C465E285E.description: Investigate the apprenticeship process in a trade of personal interest.

4567877AD2DD480C85006C983B885EBD.description: Investigate available programs and opportunities such as the Saskatchewan Youth Apprenticeship program and secondary apprenticeship credits that support transitions from high school.

FE342CA14D9347E19BB574BE914F4181.description: Discuss the relationship between the trades and national, provincial and territorial certification bodies including the Saskatchewan Apprenticeship and Trade Certification Commission.

3C7D52E633034A17B73D881E9DDF3F6C.description: Describe qualities of a successful apprentice.

02BD4C511F72490C95D6147478B626A5.description: Explore the advantages and disadvantages of apprenticeship for the individual and the trade.

4BAB3DC34F6E4F8BBAAAB9F53FA8929C.description: Research the history and the role of apprenticeship in the trades.

673A42D75D7442DCAAD3D77A8BD55FEE.description: Outline an entry level business plan that may include start-up costs, location, customer base, advertising and an exit plan.

F4EF51D655FD460DA734FAF999353F83.description: Explain the responsibility of a business owner to employ individuals with various levels of training (e.g., apprentice, journeyperson and Red Seal) and to provide quality customer service.

C196DA18D5BB449B92FA57078C6C9405.description: Explain the advantages of and requirements for obtaining Blue Seal certification.

19F7AA9E44E14105882F505D609EEC86.description: Research the importance of sustainable business practices such as providing quality customer service, following environmental guidelines and employing qualified and certified personnel.

C4F79A838867474EA93F0712580B03EF.description: Research the requirements (e.g., registering business name, collecting and remitting taxes, licensing and zoning) for establishing a business in one’s community.

C1324356BBFD42EDB650D1AFCD39600B.description: Explore the role of franchises as a business ownership model in the electrical and electronics industries.

026D536B7E144087B73CD4A824B45CAA.description: Investigate the advantages and disadvantages of different business ownership models, including sole proprietorship, partnerships and private corporations.

C981E4C012114ACA83A296D5B2AA3472.description: Explore electrical and electronics-related business opportunities in sectors such as agriculture, mining, power generation, communications providers and construction.

A27AD12130024F058D450659FF4F1666.description: Research the types (e.g., retail and wholesale outlets, electrical contractor and manufacturing) of business opportunities available in the electrical and electronics industries.

14DC5CA92E48499AB5585D4969EE629B.description: Investigate business opportunities in the electrical and electronics industries.

715EBA0F2C014BCCB5DD9A8A9C73AF69.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

26E31FB4550347A29CD965AD74BE84A1.description: Prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer, expressing appreciation.

F04D82FA486B4350A69C4F041838A813.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

4BBDE9CF18D4428A814DCDBBEA500484.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

A052F174B20E4ED29DF93B0733277D88.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

72EE7E124A90482896BDCAA1C88D1B89.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

7B40EDE9FCE946D3BEF8960A1FDCB8D3.description: Document knowledge and awareness of employment standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

C1EDBC2827E842BA88F834AC59C9F10D.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

B46BDD6E42C34F1BBCA175F386409C04.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

C00B09AAA3554A17ABA13F5B62E0F4A4.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

5F8E728599A0497688CC3C09A57D1E0D.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

6B851A9F16DD47A1A0184174CB3A26C0.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

7CDEF18384654C65A0913D3FC654CA9E.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

612980FA65D649C0BE9F4D434F45E8ED.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow? Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

A75DB627AC564F84961F11E1F3640A1C.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

F13AAD4EBB9C4AF9B3D0C0AFE5C100F1.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution

4543F94F7A584A1181FA29A095A7A1A5.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

85DEE46493AA43DB9625B28C71AE3E28.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations.

CE8E169AC70141388F66FF3355B234B6.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

DCD087E4819941358AF39E758C8426C5.description: Describe and reflect on the three basic rights that all workers have under Part III – Occupational Health and Safety in The Saskatchewan Employment Act, 2019: the right to know – the hazards at work and how to control them; the right to participate – in finding and controlling workplace hazards; and, the right to refuse – work that you believe is unusually dangerous.

E2DEB548663A4890B87F62D73497337F.description: Demonstrate increasing proficiency in electrical and electronic-related techniques, work skills and presentation skills.

1C822CD85F8C4F54A6485D7E29F26EC6.description: Demonstrate safe practices when working with magnetic motor control circuits.

B90494FA803443F0957A2E14BD072516.description: Recognize that the power input is equal to the power output in a transformer assuming no losses.

332FAD16120141E0925866948F420DA3.description: Calculate the primary and secondary voltage and current values of several transformers using the turns ratio formula (Tr=Vp/Vs=Np/Ns=Is/Ip): Np is the number of turns in the primary winding; Ns is the number of turns in the secondary winding; Vp is the voltage in the primary winding; Vs is the voltage in the secondary winding; Is the current in the secondary winding; and, Ip is the current in the primary winding.

6E9B3234A1394A0197D023BF35FCF80E.description: Identify industry standard personal protective equipment (PPE) such as safety goggles, footwear, hearing protection, headwear and protective clothing.
